bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to [C.B. Byrne], March 7, 1893

div1.p: Reed writes about studies leading to a paper on cholera vaccination. He also gives instructions for staining tubercle bacilli.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to [C.B. Byrne], March 7, 1893

opener.dateline:
Headquarters Department of Dakota,
ATTENDING SURGEON'S OFFICE,
St. Paul, Minn., March 7, 1893

div1.p:
You must
forgive me for my delay
in answering your letter,
but I really could not
help it. The day your
letter came, I had just
received some cultures
of Asiatic cholera and
had to give all spare
time to them so as to get
them into shape. Add
to this several quite sick
patients, & you see that
I had to hump myself- I
tried to get to Noyes Bros.
Saturday afternoon, but
couldn't succeed. I send
by to-day's mail, one ounce
each of Fuchsin & Methylene
blue- The bill amounts to
$1.00- Am glad to know that
you are going to try your
hand at Bacteriology a
little. I am studying, at
present the “Comma bacillus”
& the “cholera nostras” or-
ganism & hope to deliver an
address on the subject of
preventive inoculation against
cholera before the Med. Society
on March 27. With kindest regards
to Mrs. B. & yourself, sincerely, yours,
Walter Reed

Prepare the following solutions.
Acid. Carbolic. cryst. 5 c.c.
Distilled water 100 c.c.
Alcohol. 10 c.c.
Fuchsin 1 gramme.

Methylene Blue 1 gramme.
Sol. Caustic Potash (1 ptds- 10.000 aq.) 100, c.c.
Label- “Loeffler's Methylene Blue”-

These solutions keep well
for about 3 or 4 weeks --
Having prepared a thin cover
slip (which should be clean)
let it dry & then pass through
flame of alcohol lamp
three times -(just as you
would count, “one”, “two”, “three”,)
Then holding slip still with
forceps, drop on its upper
surface a few drops of
Carbol-Fuchsin sol. with
medicine dropper & hold over
the flame until it begins
to steam - approach it a little
nearer & even if it bubbles
there is no harm- Renew
carbol. Fuchsin sol. & keep
steaming for three minutes-
Then decolorize in a sol. of sulph-
uric acid in water -(one pt. to
7.) holding slip with forceps- You
will observe greenish cloud given
off- Keep it in this for 30 to
60 seconds- & then into a sol. of
alcohol in water (-70 per ct. sol.)
reddish cloud of liberated fuchsin
will pass off- in this for a few
seconds & then wash out in water-
Then add sol. Methylene blue, a few drops
to upper surface of slip & let it remain
one or two minutes - wash in
water, & either let the slip
become air-dry or dry its
by holding it between your
fingers over alcohol flame.
Place a drop of canda balsam
on a slide & turn cover slip
down on it - Examine with
oil immersion lens-

I hope that I have made
myself sufficiently explicit.
